title: moveto: Thinks that the file already exists if the src and dst filenames are the same
body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
```
rclone v1.38
- os/arch: linux/arm
- go version: go1.9
```

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Raspbian (running on a raspberry pi)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Dropbox

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```bash
pi@pi:~/Dropbox $ rclone --log-level DEBUG moveto "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg"
2017/10/11 15:09:14 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/pi/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2017/10/11 15:09:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--log-level" "DEBUG" "moveto" "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg"]
2017/10/11 15:09:16 INFO  : Dropbox root 'Family/Media/Photos/2017/03': Modify window is 1s
2017/10/11 15:09:16 DEBUG : Dropbox root 'Family/Media/Photos/2017/03': don't need to copy/move 2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg, it is already at target location
2017/10/11 15:09:16 INFO  :
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:        1.6s

2017/10/11 15:09:16 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 5
2017/10/11 15:09:16 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "--log-level" "DEBUG" "moveto" "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg"]
```

Here you can see that even though the `src` and `dst` paths are different, the filenames stay the same, I'm simply trying to move a file (unmodified) from one directory to another.

To verify that the target actually does not yet exist in the remote, here is a `lsd` along the path that shows that the `2017` directory doesn't actually exist yet.

```bash
pi@pi:~/Dropbox $ rclone lsd dropbox:Family/Media/Photos
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2003
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2004
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2005
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2007
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2008
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2009
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2010
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2011
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2012
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2013
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2014
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2015
          -1 2017-10-11 15:10:51        -1 2016
```

Now when I try and run the same `moveto` command, but with a slightly modified filename for the `dst` it looks to work.

```bash
pi@pi:~/Dropbox $ rclone --log-level DEBUG moveto "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06-a.jpg"
2017/10/11 15:17:18 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/pi/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2017/10/11 15:17:18 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--log-level" "DEBUG" "moveto" "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06-a.jpg"]
2017/10/11 15:17:20 INFO  : Dropbox root 'Family/Media/Photos/2017/03': Modify window is 1s
2017/10/11 15:17:20 DEBUG : 2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg: Couldn't find file - need to transfer
2017/10/11 15:17:23 INFO  : 2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg: Moved (server side)
2017/10/11 15:17:23 INFO  :
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:        4.8s

2017/10/11 15:17:23 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 5
2017/10/11 15:17:23 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "--log-level" "DEBUG" "moveto" "dropbox:camera uploads/2017-03-06 13.33.06.jpg" "dropbox:Family/Media/Photos/2017/03/2017-03-06 13.33.06-a.jpg"]
```
